Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Finding & rendering views fails when targeting net471" (#3088) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Easily reproduce:

```
git clone https://github.com/onionhammer/Wivuu.RazorInline.git
cd Wivuu.RazorInline
dotnet test 
```

Should pass. Now change tests/tests.csproj to target net471 instead of netcoreapp2.0 and re-run the tests. This produces the following:

System.InvalidOperationException: Unable to find view 'ViewTest'. The following locations were searched:
/Views/ViewTest.cshtml
/Views/Shared/ViewTest.cshtml
/Pages/Shared/ViewTest.cshtml


@pranavkm This is related to https://github.com/aspnet/Razor/issues/2274#issuecomment-383738252

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "StaticFiles that return a 404 could use more diagnostic information" (#3123) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @csharpfritz on May 5, 2018 16:36_

A little diagnostic information when logging a 404 for a static file would be very helpful.

Perhaps adding something like "searched in folder '/app/wwwroot/lib/WHATEVER'" would be beneficial to help debug simple configuration errors

_Copied from original issue: aspnet/KestrelHttpServer#2549_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Unix socket bidding with Owin not working" (#3122) at aspnet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Hi,

I'm trying to use unix socket with Owin and Nancy activated. With the `ListenUnixSocket()` all of my requests return `500` whereas with the standard tcp bidding `Listen()` everything is fine !
Here is the stack trace, thanks to `UseDeveloperExceptionPage()`:
```
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Owin.OwinEnvironment.<>c.<.ctor>b__2_50(IHttpConnectionFeature feature)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Owin.OwinEnvironment.FeatureMap`1.<>c__DisplayClass2_0.<.ctor>b__0(Object feature)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Owin.OwinEnvironment.FeatureMap.TryGet(HttpContext context, Object& value)
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Owin.OwinEnvironment.System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<System.String,System.Object>.TryGetValue(String key, Object& value)
   at Nancy.Owin.NancyMiddleware.Get[T](IDictionary`2 env, String key)
   at Nancy.Owin.NancyMiddleware.<>c__DisplayClass2_1.<<UseNancy>b__1>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ValidateEnd(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.GetResult()
   at Microsoft.AspNetCore.Owin.WebSocketAcceptAdapter.<>c__DisplayClass6_0.<<AdaptWebSockets>b__0>d.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ValidateEnd(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.GetResult()
```

Any ideas ?

Dotnet and owin version --> 2.0.2
Nancy --> 2.0.0

Thanks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "UseHub is in the wrong namespace" (#2225) at aspnet/SignalR
Events.RelatedBody:
UseHub is in the Microsoft.AspNetCore.SignalR namespace and it should be in the Microsoft.AspNetCore.Connections namespace (matching the IConnectionBuilder namespace).

/cc @muratg @anurse

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "AcceptedResult should be a StatusCodeResult" (#7730) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody: Most of the status action results follow the rule that *Result is a StatusCodeResult and *ObjectResult is an ObjectResult. The AcceptedResult makes people confused and might cause trouble if they have their custom OutputFormatter. I suggest that create a AcceptedObjectResult to replace the original AcceptedResult, then make the AcceptedResult inherits StatusCodeResult.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "XmlSerializerOutputFormatter can't serialize DataSets with object (sql_variant) columns" (#7741) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
#### Bug:
The following exception is thrown when a DataSet is serialized with the **XmlSerializerOutputFormatter**, and the DataSet contains a column of type "xs:anyType".
```
There was an error generating the XML document. Invalid name character in 'xmlns:xs'. The ':' character, hexadecimal value 0x3A, cannot be included in a name.
```
#### Steps to reproduce or link to a repro project:

1. Create a Controller with an Action that returns a DataSet.
2. The Action must be configured to return xml. For instance by using the Produces("application/xml") attribute.
3. Add **XmlSerializerOutputFormatter** to the OutputFormatters collections in the Startup method.
4. Create and return a DataSet that returns a column of type xs.anyType. For instance, by executing the following SQL query: 
`"select SERVERPROPERTY ( 'ServerName' ) AS ServerName"`

#### Version of Microsoft.AspNetCore.All:
2.0.7

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding multiple InputTagHelper breaks "checkbox" functionality" (#5902) at aspnet/Mvc
Events.RelatedBody:
As documented [here](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/42544961/asp-net-core-custom-input-tag-helper-rendering-duplicate-checkboxes), "checkbox" inputs do not work the same as all other input elements.  The fix mentioned on stackoverflow is only a hack if you are using a single InputTagHelper.

If you create a custom TagHelper that inherits from InputTagHelper, the attributes cascade for each input element, so that if you add additional functionality such as adding an additional attribute, then the attributes get picked up.  In the current code, you end up with same same number of "checkbox" and "hidden" elements as the number of InputTagHelpers you use, but only for "checkbox".  All other input elements work correctly.  Also, you can see that each new checkbox only has attributes for the specific custom InputTagHelper that is used, and the attributes don't get merged like the other input elements do.

This is what I end up with the current code:

```html
<input data-val="true" data-val-required="The UsingCreditCard field is required." id="UsingCreditCard" name="UsingCreditCard" type="checkbox" value="true" />
<input name="UsingCreditCard" type="hidden" value="false" />
<input disabled="disabled" id="UsingCreditCard" name="UsingCreditCard" type="checkbox" value="true" />
<input name="UsingCreditCard" type="hidden" value="false" />
<input data-agl="agl" id="UsingCreditCard" name="UsingCreditCard" type="checkbox" value="true" />
<input name="UsingCreditCard" type="hidden" value="false" />
```

Instead of this:

```html
<input data-agl="agl" data-val="true" data-val-required="The UsingCreditCard field is required." disabled="disabled" id="UsingCreditCard" name="UsingCreditCard" type="checkbox" value="true" />
<input name="UsingCreditCard" type="hidden" value="false" />
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump Roslyn dependency to 2.8.0" (#2333) at aspnet/Razor
Opened issue "Make Razor's Workspace lookup logic more flexible to other variations of the C# content type." (#2335) at aspnet/Razor
Events.RelatedBody:
We should change [this](https://github.com/aspnet/Razor/blob/b538f22ad58da4b4cd79b9c1c5e7f353f11fc52c/src/Microsoft.VisualStudio.LanguageServices.Razor/DefaultVisualStudioWorkspaceAccessor.cs#L83) to look for the `"Roslyn"` content type instead of the `"CSharp"` content type. Given that this code is being called we're already guaranteed to be in an ASP.NET Core Razor scenario which only supports C#.

This unblocks liveshare scenarios were content types get changed to have remote prefixes/suffixes.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ASP.NET Core WebHooks moved out of ASP.NET Core 2.1" (#299) at aspnet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
We are moving ASP.NET Core WebHooks out of the ASP.NET Core 2.1 to give more time to validate the design and implementation. We will continue to ship previews ASP.NET Core WebHooks packages, but they not ship as stable packages as part of the ASP.NET Core 2.1 release.

### Why?

[ASP.NET Core WebHooks](https://github.com/aspnet/webhooks) is only a partial port of [ASP.NET WebHooks](https://github.com/aspnet/aspnetwebhooks) and hasn't received sufficient attention during the ASP.NET Core 2.1 release for us to feel comfortable shipping it at this time.
